ai.summary: A 13.3 km moderate hike along the Linlithgow Marches Perambulation route in the UK. The route blends rural tracks and historic landscapes with modest elevation changes, suitable for hikers with a moderate fitness level.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain is mixed: rural tracks, field edges, minor roads, and occasional gates or stiles. Ground can be uneven and muddy after rain. Expect gentle to moderate climbs and several longer flat sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before setting out; carry a map and compass or GPS, and ensure someone knows your route and ETA. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; farmland sections require respect for livestock and crops. Be prepared for patchy mobile signal, road traffic on short sections, and possible mud; carry water, snacks, a first aid kit, and a whistle for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight (in case of low light or delays)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn for the best conditions; hikes are feasible year-round with proper gear and daylight; winter can be wetter and colder.

seo.title: Linlithgow Marches Perambulation Route – 13.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Linlithgow Marches Perambulation route, a 13.3 km moderate hike through rural tracks and historic landscapes in the UK. Safety tips and gear guidance included.
